description: A House-Boat on the Styx was a novel written by John Kendrick Bangs and published in 1895. The idea behind this book is that everyone who has ever died has gone to Styx. The Styx is what can be described as “a universal collecting pot for dead souls, regardless of their deeds in life.” At the start of the book we are introduced to Charon, a ferryman for the Styx, who is worried about the sudden appearance of this House-Boat. He is worried that it is in direct competition to his livelihood. What follows are eleven more stories, which take place on the house boat. The collection has no central theme except the exploration of what would happen if various notable dead people from varying times were put together in one place. To have access to this classic masterpiece download our ebook today!
